intro: Hieracium nobile var. subaequale, commonly known as the noble dandelion, is a variant of the common dandelion with distinctive botanical features. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring a hairy stem and alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The flowers are yellow, with a prominent central disk surrounded by ray florets, and they bloom from late spring to early autumn. The plant produces a fluffy, white seed head that disperses seeds via the wind. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils.
